context.description: To confirm that you want to create a new server project with the given name, click OK.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box allows you to select the resources that you want published to the remote server or removed from the remote server.

The list displays the resources in your workspace that satisfy the filter criteria. The default filter criteria displays all the resources that are published to the server. To change the filter criteria, click Filter Resources. Depending on the status of the resource, appropriate actions are displayed in the Action column. To publish resource to a server or to remove it from a server, select the resource in the Workspace Resource column, select the appropriate checkbox in the Action column and then select OK. Selecting Select all selects all the resources in the list. Selecting Deselect all clears the resource selection in the list.

The list displays the resources in your workspace that satisfy the filter criteria. The default filter criteria displays all the resources that are published to the server. To change the filter criteria, click Filter Resources. Depending on the status of the resource, appropriate actions are displayed in the Action column. To publish resource to a server or to remove it from a server, select the resource in the Workspace Resource column, select the appropriate checkbox in the Action column and then select OK. Selecting Select all selects all the resources in the list. Selecting Deselect all clears the resource selection in the list.

The list displays the resources in your workspace that satisfy the filter criteria. The default filter criteria displays all the resources that are published to the server. To change the filter criteria, click Filter Resources. Depending on the status of the resource, appropriate actions are displayed in the Action column. To publish resource to a server or to remove it from a server, select the resource in the Workspace Resource column, select the appropriate checkbox in the Action column and then select OK. Selecting Select all selects all the resources in the list. Selecting Deselect all clears the resource selection in the list.

The list displays the resources in your workspace that satisfy the filter criteria. The default filter criteria displays all the resources that are published to the server. To change the filter criteria, click Filter Resources. Depending on the status of the resource, appropriate actions are displayed in the Action column. To publish resource to a server or to remove it from a server, select the resource in the Workspace Resource column, select the appropriate checkbox in the Action column and then select OK. Selecting Select all selects all the resources in the list. Selecting Deselect all clears the resource selection in the list.

This dialog allows you to select one or more of the following filters to be used when displaying resources in the Publishing dialog. - Unpublished resources to display those resources that are never published to the server. This is selected by default. - Added resources to display those resources that have been added to the workspace. - Unmodified resources to display those resources that have not been changed. - Modified resources to display those resources that have been changed. - Deleted resources to display those resources that have been deleted from the workspace.
This change cannot be undone.
Informational message indicating that server is not responding and that you may want to terminate it by clicking OK.
Use to set the preferences that servers will use for testing projects.
Set the preferences for the servers by selecting the appropriate check box.
Specifies that a monitor opens to display messages when files are published.
Specifies that all the files should automatically be published before starting the server.
Specifies that the server tools can automatically restart the server when it detects that the server must be restarted to handle resource changes in the workspace.

Displays a list of available publishing methods. Select Prompt user if you want choose which resources to publish to the server or to remove from the server. Select Smart Publish if you want Server Tools to publish to the server only changed resources. All resources that no longer exist in the workspace are deleted on the server. This is the default value. Select Publish all if you want to publish all resources to the server, regardless of whether they have changed. No resources are deleted from the server.
Specifies that the server tools can automatically restart the server when it detects that the server must be restarted to handle resource changes in the workspace.
Specifies that the server tools will prompt you before you make a change in a editor that cannot be undone.
Specifies the length of time the server tools will wait, when the server is not responding, before it prompts you to terminate the server.

Specifies the preferences for saving the changes in any open server editors before starting the server. Select Never to never save the changes in any open editors before starting the server. Select Prompt to have the server tools prompt you before saving any changes in an open server editor. Select Auto-save to have the server tools automatically save any changes in an open server editor before starting the server.

The Server Configuration view allows you to manage servers and server configurations. This view displays a list of all the servers that reside in your workspace. To view the server configurations, click the Menu icon and select View > Advanced. The advanced Server Configuration view opens, displaying the servers and their associated configurations.

The Server view allows you to manage servers. This view displays a list of all your servers and the server configurations that are associated with each server. You can use this view to start, start in debug mode, restart, and stop servers.
Use to import a server configuration that is located outside of the workspace but is on the same machine.
The name assigned to the server configuration that you want to import.
The name of the server project that will contain the server configuration that you want to import. Select the name from the list of available server projects.
The type of server configuration that will be imported. Select a type from the list of available configuration types.
The location from which you want to import a server configuration. You may either type the fully qualified pathin the Location field if you know it, or click Browse to find it.
The location from which you want to import a server configuration. You may either type the fully qualified path in the Location field if you know it, or click Browse to find it.
This wizard creates a new server configuration, which contains information required to set up a server for testing or for publishing.
The name that you want to assign to this new server configuration.
The name of the server project folder in which you want the server configuration to reside. Select the name from the list of available server project folders or type in a new name.
The type of server that the new configuration represents. Select a type from the list and read the description that appears in the Description area of this wizard page.
This wizard creates a new server, which contains information required to point to a specific run-time environment for local or remote testing, or for deployment to an application server.
The name that you want to assign to this new server.
The name of the server project folder in which you want the server to reside. Select the name from the list of available server project folders or type in a new name.

The type of environment that you want to use for this server. A list of available server types is shown. For more details on each of the supported server types, select a type from the list and read the description that appears in the Description area of this wizard page.

This wizard creates a new server and a new server configuration. A server contains information required to point to a specific run-time environment for local or remote testing, or for deployment to an application server. A server configuration contains information required to set up and deploy to a server.
he name that you want to assign both to the server and the server configuration.
The name of the server project folder in which you want the server to reside. Select the name from the list of available server project folders or type in a new name.

The type of environment that you want to use for this server. A list of available server types is shown. For more details on each of the supported server types, select a type from the list and read the description that appears in the Description area of this wizard page.
If a resource can run on several server clients, this dialog box will display them allowing you to select which one will be used.
If a resource can run on several server clients, this dialog box will display them allowing you to select which one will be used.
Select a server to launch.
Select an existing server.
List of existing servers that can be launched.
Create a new server to launch.
List of types of servers that can be launched.
A preferred server is the server that you want to use when a project has more than one server defined. Click to set the selected server as your preferred server.
To confirm that you want to launch the selected object, click Finish.

In the Available projects list, specify the projects that you want to add to the server by clicking Add. When you select a project to add to the server, only the projects that are applicable to the type of server will appear. To remove a project from the Configured projects list, click Remove.
